definitions.definition: Extreme aversion or detestation ; the feeling of utter dislike or loathing .
An expression of abhorrence, in particular any of the parliamentary addresses dictated towards Charles II.
A person or thing that is loathsome ; a detested thing.

main_definition: ( uncountable , countable ) Extreme aversion or detestation ; the feeling of utter dislike or loathing . [Mid 17 century.]
secondary_definitions: ( countable , obsolete , historical ) An expression of abhorrence, in particular any of the parliamentary addresses dictated towards Charles II. [Late 17 century.]
( countable ) A person or thing that is loathsome ; a detested thing. [Mid 18 century.]
